definition: to give or have an acupuncture treatment
penetrating (as of cold)/struggle
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]

sentences.english: Often acupuncture needles are not inserted in the place where the patient feels pain.
sentences.chinese: 通常情況下，並不在病人感覺到疼痛的地方扎針。

sentences.english: It was like a hand pinching an arm numbed by an injection.
sentences.chinese: 這就像一隻手掐住了扎針引起麻木的胳膊一樣。

sentences.english: Do you have the sensation of distension and numbness at needling?
sentences.chinese: 扎針時您有麻木和發脹的感覺嗎？

sentences.english: When I insert the needles into points you may have a feeling of soreness.
sentences.chinese: 扎針時您有麻木和發脹的感覺嗎？

sentences.english: The government propagandizes said "performs acupuncture" by the human cannot infect, is wrong.
sentences.chinese: 政府宣傳說被人“扎針”不會被傳染，是錯誤的。

sentences.english: That doctor is very good at giving needle treatment.
Jake : Nobody said I had to get a shot .
Don't be afraid. The needles won't hurt you.
sentences.chinese: 不要怕，扎針不會叫你疼的。

sentences.english: But surprisingly, fake acupuncture works just as well as the real thing.
sentences.chinese: 但令人驚訝的是，假鍼灸和真正的扎針一樣有效。

sentences.english: How did you feel after acupuncture last time?
sentences.chinese: 上次扎針以後，有什麼反應？

definition: to fester/to suppurate/to be infected
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
a stitch/surgical stitches
needle
to feel sb's pulse
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
to reduce fever
to apply a hot compress
to hit a pressure point (martial arts)/dim mak/see also 點脈|点脉[dian3 mai4]
to ache dully
to prick with a needle/to treat by acupuncture
antipyretic (drug to reduce fever, such as sulfanilamide)
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to put sb on an intravenous drip
to burn/to scorch/to cauterize
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
